intro: Alloplectus ichthyoderma var. hirsutulus, commonly known as the hairy leaf liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and possesses small, closely spaced leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophores, are specialized for sexual reproduction and are often clustered near the leaf bases. Alloplectus ichthyoderma var. hirsutulus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
